The dynamics of what even Google calls its management "triumvirate" are somewhat murky, but the co-founders appear to worry more about idealism, while Eric Schmidt has advocated increased commercialisation. the crazies. Left and right are not always at odds. In Donald Rumsfeld 's autobiography, we see him strike unstereotypical positions, pro civil rights, pro Kennedy. He admiringly quotes a Belgian ambassador: What one needs in life are the pessimism of intelligence and the optimism of will. Doesn't that describe Ronald Reagan , and Winston Churchill , heroes of the right? Yet the quote originally comes from the Italian communist Antonio Gramsci . Politics can coalesce- the Iraq war even united William Hague and Christopher Hitchens .
